title.narrative: Scaling Up Nutrition Learning and Evaluation (SUN L&E)

description.narrative: (Zambia): Zambia's high rates of child stunting have persisted for several decades with 45-50% in rural areas. According to Zambia's Demographic and Health Survey 2018, stunting levels reduced to 35% from 40% in 2014 at the national level but more can be done. The Scaling Up Nutrition Learning and Evaluation (SUN LE) mechanism is a contributor to the Government of the Republic of Zambia (GRZ)-led 1,000 Most Critical Days Program (MCDP) that aims to reduce stunting through a partnership with donors. SUN LE is the learning and evaluation arm of the entire MCDP, including USAID's Scaling Up Nutrition Technical Assistance mechanism. This includes identifying, designing, and testing solutions to more effectively understand and measure outcomes to attain the GRZ and donors' joint goal to reduce stunting. FY 2020 funds will support the dissemination of the baseline results in 30 districts as well as development of a common results framework for the MCDP. Funds will also be used to conduct a performance assessment and focused studies on the implementation of GRZ nutrition services and aflatoxin management techniques to promote learning around stunting issues and to inform the greater MDCP. Further, funds will support the upgrade of the National Food and Nutrition Commission website to allow the posting of the nutrition research and communications products. SUN LE will be collecting and disseminating data to identify and promote development breakthroughs around stunting and use the data to modify and improve activities. This mechanism is working towards preventing stunting in future generations, supporting USAID's development objective to improve health outcomes and meet critical needs of vulnerable populations. The mechanism will support the Mission's Development Objective 3: Capacity of Zambia's Government, Citizens and Private Sector Increased to Improve Health Outcomes and Meet Critical Needs of Vulnerable Populations.....
